Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I imagine I could make a betblaster

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it wouldnt need to be complex

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: get the list of entropy utxos, get a list of your local utxo

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think the problem is just that its eelecting the same inputs... I have a skip of 80% in the uxto selection in CCtx.cpp but its not enough

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: allocate enough for a dicebet and construct a dicebet tx, proceed to next utxos

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the trick is to allocate for all the bets at once

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: see how i did the dicefinish

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: ive read some of it but not in depth yet.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you dont need anything so fancy

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just make two utxo lists

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and construct a valid dicebet tx

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: @ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉 it should

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think I understand what you mean, does not seem difficult at all really

Author: jl777c#5810
jl777c#5810
Content: you just need to use a different entropytxid/v0 for each one

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you make it broadcast after each one is created, then AddNormalinputs will check the mempool

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
now if you made the bet a fixed size for the blast and premake the correct sized utxo, then you can change the AddNormalInputs() call to just be:
mtx.vin.push_back(CTxIn(txids[i],vins[i],CScript()));

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: since you are allocating from the same array in an incrementing fashion, you wont conflict with any of your own dicebets

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: really, that is all that is needed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just hinge off of funcid.E they are valid entropy utxo, so you can scan for them

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in any case, being able to construct a valid CC tx is very useful as we really need to test making illegal tx and make sure the validation catches them properly

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: sounds like a good mission.
